conbody.p: The HAL has support for argument handling that is compliant with the UHI specification. This interface is implemented by the _start application entry point.
$r4 is the control register for determining how arguments are passed.

row.entry: All other registers are ignored. A null argument vector is created for main with argc == 0, argv[0] == 0 *envp == 0.
$r4 contains argc, $r5 contains argv, $r6 contains envp. Envp contains a null terminated of char* pointers with each string being in the format key=value.
The UHI interface is used to obtain the command line. The memory for the argv array is allocated from the start of the application stack.
